title: Coração Partido (Corazón Partío) - Ao Vivo
licensing_note: Lyrics via Musixmatch API; translations via Google Translate API; grammar notes auto-generated placeholders.

lines.text: Não tem jeito meu compadre, 'vambora
lines.translation: There's no way around it, my friend, let's go!
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Identify the main verb, its ending, and any prefix movement. Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'There's no way around it, my friend, let's go!'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: Ela vacilou comigo, e nós 'tamo aí, tudo certo
lines.translation: She hesitated with me, but we're still here, everything's alright.
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Verb focus: vacilou (check person/tense and prefixes). Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'She hesitated with me, but we're still here, everything's alright.'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: Eu tentei ficar com você
lines.translation: I tried to stay with you.
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Verb focus: tentei, ficar (check person/tense and prefixes). Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'I tried to stay with you.'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: Eu lutei, insisti, persisti, mas você só brincou
lines.translation: I fought, I insisted, I persisted, but you just played games.
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Verb focus: lutei, brincou (check person/tense and prefixes). Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'I fought, I insisted, I persisted, but you just played games.'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: Sempre me levou na brincadeira
lines.translation: He always took me in stride.
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Verb focus: levou (check person/tense and prefixes). Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'He always took me in stride.'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: E preferiu a vida de solteira
lines.translation: And she preferred the single life.
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Identify the main verb, its ending, and any prefix movement. Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'And she preferred the single life.'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: Vida de balada, vida de revoada
lines.translation: Party life, flock life
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Identify the main verb, its ending, and any prefix movement. Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'Party life, flock life'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: Agora vem se arrepender
lines.translation: Now you'll regret it.
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Verb focus: arrepender (check person/tense and prefixes). Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'Now you'll regret it.'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: Se você me amava
lines.translation: If you loved me
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Identify the main verb, its ending, and any prefix movement. Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'If you loved me'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: Por que me machucou?
lines.translation: Why did you hurt me?
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Verb focus: machucou (check person/tense and prefixes). Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'Why did you hurt me?'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: Se me amava, cê foi me trair por quê?
lines.translation: If you loved me, why did you betray me?
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Verb focus: trair (check person/tense and prefixes). Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'If you loved me, why did you betray me?'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: Eu não vou negar que ainda te amo
lines.translation: I won't deny that I still love you.
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Verb focus: negar (check person/tense and prefixes). Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'I won't deny that I still love you.'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: Mas você merece o meu abandono
lines.translation: But you deserve to be abandoned by me.
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Identify the main verb, its ending, and any prefix movement. Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'But you deserve to be abandoned by me.'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: O que eu mais queria era ficar contigo
lines.translation: What I wanted most was to be with you.
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Verb focus: ficar (check person/tense and prefixes). Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'What I wanted most was to be with you.'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: Mas você deixou meu coração partido
lines.translation: But you broke my heart.
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Verb focus: deixou (check person/tense and prefixes). Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'But you broke my heart.'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: E agora, nem pintada de ouro eu te quero
lines.translation: And now, I don't want you even if you were painted gold.
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Identify the main verb, its ending, and any prefix movement. Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'And now, I don't want you even if you were painted gold.'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: Eu não vou sentir pena de te ver sofrendo
lines.translation: I won't feel sorry for you seeing you suffer.

Meaning: 'I won't feel sorry for you seeing you suffer.'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.
